intro: Lupinus flavopinuum, commonly known as the yellow pine lupine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, compound leaves with small, lance-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Lupinus flavopinuum is notable for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation, supporting local biodiversity.
